channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why companies are leaning into skills-first, AI-enabled employment models
item.description: Moving away from job-centric structures may become more common.

item.title: Young people aren’t anti-capitalist. They’re just sick of corporate hypocrisy
item.description: Zohran Mamdani's New York City mayoral primary win sparked major questions about what Gen Z wants from both their political and business leaders.

item.title: U.S. Will Join Thailand-Cambodia Cease-Fire Talks, Rubio Says
item.description: U.S.-backed talks to end the border war, in which militaries have killed dozens of people and displaced hundreds of thousands, began on Monday in Mala...

item.title: Nevada Democrats Spot an Opportunity in a Vulnerable G.O.P. Governor
item.description: The state attorney general, Aaron Ford, is seen as Democrats’ best bet to oust Gov. Joe Lombardo. Mr. Lombardo doesn’t plan on going down easy.

item.title: Flex’s CEO took the job without industry experience. One battle-tested playbook guided every move
item.description: Flex’s CEO didn’t pretend to know the business when she assumed the corner office. Instead, she stuck to what she could control.

item.title: Meet the ‘masters of the universe’ heading up the private credit explosion
item.description: Ares Management has become one of the top alternative asset managers in the red-hot field, with aims to grow to $750 billion.

item.title: Jeff Bezos’s honeymoon plans involved a $5.7 billion Amazon share selloff
item.description: Despite the large, prearranged sales, Bezos still holds roughly 884 million Amazon shares and maintains a net worth of $252 billion.

item.title: ‘Revenge Is Not a Policy’: Israelis Voice Dissent Against the War in Gaza
item.description: After a long silence, prominent Israelis and activists are increasingly raising alarms about potential war crimes being carried out by the government.

item.title: Outrage Grows Over Starvation in Gaza, and a Mysterious Pentagon Budget Line
item.description: Plus, a very D.I.Y. act of defiance.

item.title: U.S. Will Join Thailand-Cambodia Cease-Fire Talks, Rubio Says
item.description: U.S.-backed talks to end the border war, in which militaries have killed dozens of people and displaced hundreds of thousands, began on Monday in Mala...

item.title: Trump Administration Live Updates: President to Host Starmer at His Golf Courses in Scotland
item.description: The leaders were expected to discuss a dispute over U.S. tariffs on British metals, as well as the crisis in Gaza. President Trump is fresh off a win ...

item.title: Shooting at Bangkok Market Leaves Several People Dead
item.description: The gunman killed five people at Or Tor Kor market, which is popular with tourists, before dying by suicide, the authorities said.

item.title: ‘Revenge Is Not a Policy’: Israelis Voice Dissent Against the War in Gaza
item.description: After a long silence, prominent Israelis and activists are increasingly raising alarms about potential war crimes being carried out by the government.

item.title: C.D.C. Ties 85 Cases of THC-Related Symptoms to Wisconsin Restaurant
item.description: The restaurant mistakenly used oil infused with THC, a psychoactive ingredient found in many cannabis products, in food preparation last year, the C.D...

item.title: Heavy Rain Likely Caused Deadly German Train Derailment, Investigators Say
item.description: Television news footage showed bent tracks and piles of mud at the scene of the accident near the town of Riedlingen in southern Germany. Three people...
